website_summaries.verdict: About half the cost of similar models. A large number of tools for the price. Your best choice if you want a Leatherman on a budget.
pros: Leatherman's original multi-tool with 14 tools in a midsize, stainless steel unit
cons: Feels a bit less durable than costlier models, and some of the tools (short file, flat-head screwdriver) aren't very effective

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. I started out with Leatherman. Received as a gift. Lost it, bought a cheap no-name brand, loved it, not sure why, lost it. Received another Leatherman as a gift. Hate it. Nice looking, very well made, poorly designed, none of the tools work well, suspect designed by someone who's never used a tool. I’m back here looking for another no-name cheapo knock-off. They’re not as pretty, not as well put together but they are way more useful. Better tool selection, softer steel means sharper and needle nose pliers can actually grip something harder than a wad of gum. There make nice gifts. They stick as a tool.
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great "budget" multitool
customer_reviews.text: Good selection of tools, if you think you will be using a saw, go for this one, otherwise grab the Wingman The saw goes through small trees very easily, and the knife blade comes razor sharp from the factory. The pliers are spring loaded, and work great, and so do the wire cutters. The other tools work as expected
customer_reviews.author: Aditya Bawankule

customer_reviews.title: Weird combination and location of tools, no positive locking mechansim for tools other than the knife and saw.
customer_reviews.text: The tools (except for the knife blade and saw) don't lock in place, just friction detents. Can't get used to where the knife blade is located; not sure why but it is instinctual with my Leatherman Wave, Surge and Sketool, but I have to fiddle and look at the Sidekick to open the knife. I wish the little serrated blade was accessible from the outside instead of the saw. In fact, I wish the saw was replaced with something more useful, like scissors. Really. what do you need to saw with this little thing that you can't just break over your knee?
customer_reviews.author: Mark (Bump)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Tools hard to deploy not as advertised. Wire cutters do not work. Liner locks very hard to use. Medium screwdriver too thick. It badly needs lubrication which should have been done before selling. Leatherman needs to look at the locks on other manufacturers. My Kershaws are easily taken off lock to close the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be fine, other than a bunch of finger prints that ...
customer_reviews.text: The seller, Hardware Sales, Inc, clearly sent a repackaged leatherman. I have zero tolerance for that. It appears to be fine, other than a bunch of finger prints that are not my own. The saw blade is pretty thin. Aside from that, the quality is what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: I'm in the army and first one was great, bought it at a sporting store
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have bought, I'm in the army and first one was great, bought it at a sporting store, loaned To a coworker and they dropped it when we were in the field, so I bought he same exact one but on Amazon, knife broke the tip off second day I had it. From opening a box just cutting tape. Seems like it wasn't same quality. Still use other parts of it but it's really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but feels cheap!
customer_reviews.text: All my previous Lethermans have felt indestructible. This one feels like it's going to fall apart in my hands. Its constructed of thin stamped steel, and the arms don't lock in place securely. They just wobble around when it's closed. While it works, I think they only reason for that is I've barely used the thing. If I was really wrenching on it, it think it would of broken months ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zakary

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking or camping
customer_reviews.text: Good tool and a slightly lighter weight to take on camping or backpacking trips has everything you would need to make repairs in those situations it is what you would expect from leatherman very durable. This doesn’t have a spring loaded pliers which was what I was looking for. I have had this 7 years now and it works as good as the day I got it if I ever lose it I wouldn’t hesitate to buy again
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: NEVER LEAVE HOME WITHOUT IT
customer_reviews.text: I'm a person who always likes to be prepared for every situation so I carry this multi tools with me every I go, when I'm driving I keep a tool box in my car but I can't carry a tool box everywhere I go when I'm not in my vehicle and I don't want to carry heavy tools on me but this size is perfect for transporting, can't carry in federal buildings, airports, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Chris

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with a leatherman
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best multi tool I’ve ever used. I have two of these now, my first was obtained from a friend I served oversees with. This tool pulled brass out of jammed up SAWs when I needed it done fast, and the blade on the knife is still sharp even years later, never being sharpened. THe second one I just bought will be a gift for my father. Can’t go wrong with a leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The other tools are great, too
customer_reviews.text: I work in the homebuilding industry, and when I'm on site, this guy is invaluable. I was surprised by how often I used the little saw- mainly cutting small shims when installing doors- since this is basically a flush saw, it can get in close. The other tools are great, too. Long lasting, quality built to it. What has sold me on it is the exterior open knife, so it completely replaced my pocket knife in my work EDC- I just wish the knife had a tack instead of the finger hole to make one handed opening easier, but after a while, you can do it pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Wear chainmail when unpacking !!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed. I bought a new tool to replace one I lost. I've cut myself twice on a sharp edge that runs along the back side of the wood blade. How it got past inspection is beyond me. Now I have to send this one back.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great edc but not for heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Im obsessed. I love how the knife and saw pop out with one hand. All of my friends have been bugging me to use this thing and it has come in handy so many times. One thing I wish was different was the bolt cutters. Theyre good, but not as good as the replaceable ones, like on the surge. I tried to cut a metal ribbon and it barely made a dent. Still a fantastic multi tool though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for price and intent.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, though a bit of wobble (compared to other leatherman products) in the handles, as I was expecting. Let this not distract you though, the price point is almost perfect, and where Leatherman cut corners is obvious and I appreciate that. The steel and tools included are top notch, and locked are quite stable. I have no doubt I will have many years use out of this and am quite happy overall. If you are looking for a multitool to do random odd jobs around the campfire, home, or work I highly recommend. The ability to take this apart is a huge plus as well. Kudos to Leatherman for a fine, working tool at an exceptional pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: Sir_Hikes_a_Lot

customer_reviews.title: Great tool I just was sold a disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: It's a great durable multitool but sadly what I got was disappointing. I've had this exact multitool before and lost it at a job site. When I got my new tool I was hoping for brand new...what I got was a grungy dirty looking multitool that is difficult to operate. All the hinges are much tighter and whatever lubricant should be there just isn't. Hoping to get a fresh new tool with flawless operation just like my last but this was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In love with this leatherman
customer_reviews.text: I use my leatherman for almost anything is so handy and yet nothing bulky on my purse, thinking on getting one for my car
customer_reviews.author: Esther Urena

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with the reliability of Leatherman. They have so many different products to choose from depending on your needs and the quality of the product is great. I just wanted a simple multi-tool to keep in an emergency bag and this one worked perfectly. Each blade is nice and sharp and there are enough uses to get you through most typical situations. Eventually I plan on getting a more expensive multi-tool from Leatherman that will provide more uses than this one but for now, it's all I need.
customer_reviews.author: natalie.b.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful machine!
customer_reviews.text: After teaching refrigeration for twenty yrs., I had a hundred students who flashed a new Leatherman as a fix everything MacGyver tool. They had a lot to learn, but at the same time I thought, "Man, I've gotta GET me one of those!" . . 'n I FINALLY did! . . now if I can keep from cuttin' my fingers off, playin' with it . . . So, I'VE GOT MY LEATHERMAN, GO 'N GET YOURS!
customer_reviews.author: Bob STEELE

customer_reviews.title: Sharp knife, great selection
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool selection. I find myself using this all the time for many different things. Way easier than carrying your tookbox around and great for those little quick home fixes when you don’t want to dig around in garage or wherever you keep your full size tools. The knife is surprisingly sharp as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality but Oddities Make It Too Pricey for What You Get
customer_reviews.text: Overall good but the Phillips head fits almost nothing and the regular driver head is so thick I had to grind it down. Great features include a good knife which has kept its edge and it's got a good saw, but for the money, you can do better, Leatherman! Signed, Leatherchick
customer_reviews.author: Heidi T.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for the price. I ordered for my son to use in Boy Scouts. He loves it. I give it 4 stars because of poor metal finishing and the clumsy design of the smaller tools. It is difficult to pull the smaller tools out for use. My Wave is a great tool and I would give it 5 stars. The Sidekick is probably the best value. Its half the price, but about 90% of the function of the Wave. The saw and a metal file are dealbreakers for me with a multi-tool. I must have them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allow the sidekick to ride by your side
customer_reviews.text: Great multi tool! Worth every penney! I usually dont like to use my more expensive tools at work so i started carrying the sidekick thinking if it breaks or falls out of my pocket im only out 30 bucks. One of my favorite things about this tool is the pocket clip. It also comes with a black nylon sheath, not the leather one. The sidekick doesnt weigh down your pocket, its not too big and bulky, and every tool on the sidekick is useful. I also like the spring loaded pliers. My other leathermans dont have this feature and it bothers me so much. Im getting ready to pick up another sidekick to keep in the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn137

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats a Leatherman!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old and perfect leatherman which I passed on to a recent graduate. This one is a little different (they don’t make mine any longer) but same super quality and outstanding functionality.

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman = Top Notch Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a multi-tool, and Leatherman is pretty much the industry standard of multi-tools. I ended up snatching up the Leatherman 831429 Sidekick Multi-Tool on an Amazon Lightening Deal. All the tools with the Leatherman 831429 Sidekick Multi-Tool are top notch, the knife has a nice sharp edge, and the saw is the best saw I've seen in a multi-tool. The spring loaded pliers is a really nice feature. This feature is a welcomed change to anyone who used pliers often. Leatherman once again produces another home run with the Leatherman 831429 Sidekick Multi-Tool. I would recommend the Leatherman 831429 Sidekick Multi-Tool to anyone looking for a quality multi-tool.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a Leatherman. What can you say. Comfortable to the grip. Much better than the older models.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Excelent for every day use, while still be acceptable to always carry around.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of different multitools (Gerber, SOG and Leatherman). Seeing how much breaks and starts to feel flimsy on the others, Leatherman is still my absolute favorite. I have had the cheaper ones before from Leatherman, but they always felt low-budget, so I just gave them away. The expensive ones are just too big and heavy to always have in your pocket. This is the first one that offers really good and strong functionality and is not too much to have in your pocket. The lighter skeletool would probably be better, but just doesn't offer the functionality that I wanted ( same with the very nice Juice).
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice multi-tool. Little or no difference from more expensive models.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned, and lost 3 Leatherman 'Wave' multi-tools; lost overboard or on job sites. There is nothing wrong at all with these tools it was just my carelessness and I just got sick and tired of paying for the 'best' of their products and then loosing them. As a result I've bought my first 'Sidekick' and couldn't be happier. They provide most of what I need when at home or work with little difference in build quality or tool availability. One pleasant surprise for me was how nice the spring loaded wire cutter is; I didn't know I needed it until I tried it. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday tool
customer_reviews.text: The sidekick is a good tool. Not the best, but nevertheless a good tool. No issues so far, even with the limited functions it's still a quality product made in America. I have been using it daily for a couple of months now - no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: redstapler

customer_reviews.title: EDC tool
customer_reviews.text: Carry this with me everywhere. Very handy tool, fairly strong and tougher than other multitools out there. Also comes with a fabric case with a loop for your belt or anything else you’d want to attach it to.
customer_reviews.author: Nemanja

customer_reviews.title: Relieved it Worked out!!!
customer_reviews.text: My best friend and I were in several hardwares for this item for her husband but we couldn't find it... We decided to take the chance and we ordered it online and it was Exactly what he wanted....
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great multitool
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift and it was very well-used and enjoyed. The Leatherman is like a bigger and badder Swiss Army knife that is used for larger projects. This came with a leather carrying pouch and is a very nice item. Highly recommend for anyone who does a lot of household projects.
customer_reviews.author: bheckelTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for dealing with life's little surprises
customer_reviews.text: Compact and sturdy. Folds up neatly and feels comfortable in your hand. I have one in each car for minor emergencies. Pliers are particularly useful for tire punctures, as tire repair kits generally don't include a tool for removing the nail or screw. I will probably never use the can- or bottle-opener, but who knows? Obviously, this should be viewed as a form of cheap insurance, not a way to replace your regular tools. (For example, I would always prefer to use a "real" screwdriver if I had one available.) However, the Sidekick is quite versatile, and the price is reasonable. I also recommend the "Wingman", which is a little cheaper and has a slightly different combination of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Henne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, superb customer service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome multi-tool! I use this numerous times per day and it can do nearly any task. Sturdy construction, very sharp blades, and easy to open and close. Leatherman also has excellent customer service. I broke the knife tip and file tip doing things they weren't meant to do and leatherman fixed and cleaned my sidekick at no charge (had to pay for shipping to their factory).
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect mix of everything I need and nothing I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect mix of everything I need and nothing I don't and the weight. Leatherman quality is evident. Perfectly dialed friction on tool opening. Love the one hand blade open feature. So easy to pull it out of my pocket and have the blade open, ready, and locked in place before the tool is at the work area. No fiddling with my other hand. Needle nose pliers are tough, yet precise enough for splinters, needles, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boyko

customer_reviews.title: Product Came As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I know some others have said they have had problems with the knife being chipped or some other type of mess up with it, but mine came perfectly fine. The pliers are spring loaded and the knife comes sharp. All around it’s a good multitool that you can easily conceal and stick in your pocket with its attached clip.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Cox

customer_reviews.title: useful EDC tool.
customer_reviews.text: Now included in what I carry everyday. Very good tool which has came in handy already. I like the fact that the screwdriver tools are fixed and not removable because I had a different style of leatherman and the screwdriver head bits fell out of it.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: It is a Leatherman - say no more
customer_reviews.text: This product speaks for itself - value, quality,history. I love mine and my son loved this one. The original and best multi purpose tool in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: James Miles

customer_reviews.title: solid performer
customer_reviews.text: This multi-tool is a nice combination of size, function and quality for this price point. The pliers are quite good, knife blades are very sharp right out of the box, and I even like the saw blade,which cuts on the pull stroke. No scissors included, but I have never found tiny scissors in a multi-tool to be very useful. There aren't so many tools built in that this becomes unwieldy, but it does have some heft. Only one minor complaint-- unless you have narrow fingers, accessing the file, wire-stripping blade and bottle opener tools is a bit tight. Overall, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Surly

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp strong blades. All the tools are tightly secure, no wiggle. Very smooth to operate. The spring loaded action is very handy too. I like the pocket clip. And the tool is small enough to fit in your pocket and not be in the way. Very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great worker bee
customer_reviews.text: I have the several Leathermans...both expensive and cheap like this Sidekick. I use the sidekick as my all around tool. I bang on it, I toss it on the ground...it gets scuffed up and its all good and it just works. If I lose it, I can replace without spending a fortune. It has all the basic tools to survive and that says it all. Its good to keep a few of these around for anytime use. I keep my more expensive Leathermans in my car emergency bags or home emergency bags. Leatherman's just do the job...plain and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this because I really like the Leatherman- its quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I really like the Leatherman- its quality, thoughtful design, usefulness, and rugged durability/dependability. Also because I've "retired" my original Leatherman for sentimental reasons (plus, I don't want to lose it).
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I've got a small Gerber multitool that I carried for years, a Leatherman Skeletool and a Leatherman Wingman. I prefer the Sidekick. Very similar to the Wingman with one-handed blade access, but the choice of tools is better. Instead of mediocre scissors a saw, and instead of a dubious blister package opener the serrated blade is its own tool instead of the back half of the main blade. I wish the file had a different pattern--I'm pretty sure a crosshatch pattern would be easier to use in a multitool, this one wants to veer.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Superb tool
customer_reviews.text: Great starter knife/tool set combo for youngsters, to have in your vehicle or bug out bag. Leatherman multi tools are the equivalent of Buck knives, they set the standard for durability and reliability. Nice and compact folding tool, comes with a good assortment for every day use. Get a nice stone or sharpening device and you'll always have a safe tool on hand when you need it. Wonderful product, this is somewhat a base model, my husband has had the original forever and from fishing to hunting to shop work, these are great for an on hand tool when you don't want to bring out the whole tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: 5150hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Sidekick is up there, in my estimation, with the Wave
customer_reviews.text: Wave is my favorite, but this is wiggling into my heart lately as it has been my EDC... I love that I don't have to open the tool to get to the knife. The clip is not as tight as it used to be, but that is to be expected. I'm pretty rough on it. It saved me on a road trip and I did some fixing on my Jeep with it unexpectedly. Most used: knife, bottle opener, pliers, flathead I tried it because it was onsale, but now that I've experienced it... if I had to pay more, I'd do it.
customer_reviews.author: AL Genaro

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman quality! Expect nothing but perfection from them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when they were on sale for about $25.00 and these made nice Christmas gifts. The knife is easy to open with one hand and it comes with a carrying belt clip pouch. The knife is pretty sharp, and the spring loaded pliers works great. I didn't care much for the mini screwdrivers as they were hard to use and flip out, but I doubt I would use it much. I've done is bought a few of these as gifts and also bought a few to keep in both my car's glove compartment for emergency situations.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Best Knife I Have
customer_reviews.text: My wife thought I spent way too much money on a dumb pocket knife, bit oh how wrong she was. I use this bad boy all the time and the quality of the tool is fantastic. Absolutely no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Cody McK3on Thompson

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Like this for a variety of jobs however blade broke. Sent back to company. Takes too long to replace blade. If u use this a lot have a back up. Overall very good tool
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Add this to any EDC bag
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my EDC bag. It will cover most of what I have a need for at this time. Could possibly upgrade to a different model at a later date
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pocket sized
customer_reviews.text: For light duty work this is the best multitool I have seen yet. It is light weight and small enough to fit in the pocket (with its pocket clip), but big enough for most jobs. I have the Wave also, but this Sidekick is better suited for pocket carry. The Wave fits better in a case on your belt. The disadvantage of this Sidekick is the limited amount of tools, but it's a bit closer to the original Leatherman which I liked best. This has locking blades, spring open pliers, and a saw. My only gripe is the Phillips head is oddly shaped, and not suited for all uses.
customer_reviews.author: kodiakcowboy

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great multitool until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great multitool until it breaks. They don’t make them like they used to. I had my first sidekick for many many years until I lost it. I bought this newer version of the sidekick and I’ve now been through 2 in the last 1.5 years, both have broken. I’ll be looking elsewhere for my next one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best multi-tool product on the market! Not only are the products itself excellent, their customer service is that much better. 25yr warranty is unheard of these days. Have to have a lot of respect for a company who doesnt sell out it's employees by shipping work overseas. Had an older leatherman with a broken flat screwdriver tip. Sent it in to Leatherman in Oregon, within 2 wks, they sent me a refurbished(might as well have been brand new) newer, updated version. Great product and company. Cannot say enough good things about leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Never leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this tool. Very sturdy, and the knife is scarey-sharp right out of the box. LOVE the carabiner it comes with, too.
customer_reviews.author: jean welch

customer_reviews.title: Typical Leatherman quality
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's a Leatherman. I've had the Wave for a decade and love it. I decided to purchase this for my emergency bag as it is a little smaller and lighter. Has a great feel in my hand. I expect it will last for many years. I once slammed the blade of my old Leatherman in the rear hatch of my Jeep and it snapped in half. I sent it in and Leatherman fixed it free of charge, no questions asked. Anyone who stands by their product like this has a lifetime customer.
customer_reviews.author: Scout538

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad as a gift and he’s already used it numerous times. It’s small enough to fit in a nice little pouch but also has plenty of tools to help get the job done! Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Imabanana

customer_reviews.title: Why haven’t you purchased one yet?
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get any better than this. Highly recommend. Great company, awesome knife. I’ve had mine for 4 yrs now and purchased this one for a nephew in the Army. It’s my EDC knife and it comes with a belt case. If I lose this one, I would definitely purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: juan hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Already Paid for Itself Several Times Over
customer_reviews.text: This was the first real Leatherman I ever bought, and so far it's paid for itself in a half a dozen small way. Can't imagine not having one after this. Thew right size, excellent quality, and a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Very good bargain tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Leatherman Multi-Tool, and the least expensive of the three; and while it is not the equal of the other two, for the price it is a very good, very well made tool, and the size is right for my application. I bought it for a specific use and have no doubt that it will preform just as well as it's more expensive brethren for this use.
customer_reviews.author: Barry D

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool and a Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I all ways wait a month or more before posting a review of what I order but sense this is my first Leatherman I have to tell you what I think of it after a week. I find it a great multi-tool to have with you and it has what I need when I need it and the way it made and how it feels in you're hand let you know you have the right tool. I do have another multi-tool but it one of those that cost only $10 it was ok but now that I got a Leatherman I use it more then the $10 one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best multitool for me
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second one for the truck. The philips bit broke off but the warranty was easy and customer service fixed it up like new.
customer_reviews.author: Chrislarson757

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a mid range tool
customer_reviews.text: This is not the high end tools like the wave, but it is good quality, nice full-size tools, without being too bulky. Highly recommended. I got this for my 15 year old son, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: this really is a quality tool. I just got it today, and had to order another one. it's so good, I'm giving it to my father-in-law for his birthday. feels well made. excellent tolerance. spent a lot of time learning about multitools. just go Leatherman. pick exactly what you want by comparing on the Leatherman site. most of them are for someone else. pick what is right for you. it should take some time. I like to carry in my pocket, and like knives and saws. this works for me. solid pliers. wire cutters are not bypass but look OK. knife and saw both very good. solid and easy to open. worth the $30.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: The inside tools need to be more useful. File is useless, phillips head kinda blows. If this had the mini screw drivers that the Leatherman Juice has, I would be into it. And scissors. The pliers actually have a bit less spread than the ones on the Juice. I love the blade shape though, and pocket clip. Nice while hiking. But I wanted a bigger knife, so I got a Wenger Ranger with saw. Then I wanted a bigger knife so I got the Schrade SCHF27. Then I wanted a bigger one so I got the Schrade kukri machete.
customer_reviews.author: soundped

customer_reviews.title: My favorite multi-tool for everyday carry
customer_reviews.text: Awesome multi-tool. Has just about every tool in it I would like. The only change I would make is take out the serrated blade and put an awl in its place. Every tool works well. The straight blade and wood saw are the best. The loop is useless. The pocket clip is a great addition to a multi-tool. I use it everyday. I am a landscaper and I find myself pulling this out of my pocket several times a day. Wether it is to tighten my pruners up, fix random equipment, saw off small branches.
customer_reviews.author: j. mort

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this puppy with the Fuse/Kick/Crunch Std Leather belt sheath. Wanted it for practical use outside and in the shop. Works GREAT. Has great tools, I think I'ved used them all about once so far. Sheath is great too, fits like a bug in a rug. I don't like the leather thing of a sheath it came with, though it is good quality. The caribiner(SP?) it came with is cool and useful though. I clip it to my belt for my flashlights and gadgets when hiking/caving. Good knife for everyday use, I have it on my all the time. Haven't had a problem with it and its been a huge help at school and work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Y

customer_reviews.title: High quality multi-tool for household use
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal, made in Oregon out of really good metal. Don't go for the cheap knockoffs when the real thing is priced so reasonably. I find having one of these in my pocket saves lots of trips to the garage for tools when doing home projects. All of the tools are very high quality down to the screwdriver blades which would be the first to go on a cheap tool.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Guy

customer_reviews.title: solid tool for a solid price
customer_reviews.text: The sidekick is a great tool. It has all the functions you would want out of a leatherman without then $100 price tag. My only complaint about the tool is in the screwdrivers. For one they dont lock like they do on many other models. And the flat head screwdriver is so thick it doesnt fit into any screws ive come across. Other than that this is a solid tool the pocket clip is well made. The knife is razor sharp right out of the box. The spring loaded pliers are also a huge plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Strand.M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: This knife has a lot of features that are great for all kinds of uses. I bought this model over the wingman because the saw tool will come in handy while hiking and being in the outdoors. I use pliers and screwdrivers all the time so I'm sure I'll be using them a good bit. I also like the wire stripper built into the side of the can opener tool. I am used to stripping wires with a knife, which even though I'm pretty good at, this will get the job done much easier. Very impressed with how well this knife is built. Very good craftsmanship went into the making of this knife. And it's American made to boot!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Cravey

customer_reviews.title: Good, if a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid multi-tool. It's very well-constructed (which all Leatherman products seem to be). I bought this as a replacement for a different model ("Juice") I had owned for several years before losing it. Compared to that one, the Sidekick is both larger and heavier, which isn't necessarily a good thing, since I carry it in my pocket every day. However, the Sidekick is also less than 1/2 the price of my old Leatherman, so some tradeoffs were inevitable. Overall, this is a worthy tool, and I expect to use it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the Businss Owner

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: The first one that I got appeared to be beat up a little. I got a very quick response from the company and the replaced it immediately. New one was perfect and my husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Should Get Good Use Out Of It
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as gift for a friend. I own a Leatherman Wave, he doesn't need something quite as fancy as that. This was a nice step down from a Wave, and for not as high of a price point. All tools seems to be in good working order. He should get good use out of it. It comes with both a belt clip and a also a pouch.
customer_reviews.author: ~Ant

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and value.
customer_reviews.text: Mid priced leatherman, with all most need. Plus changeable wire cutter, needlenose pliers, lockable blades, and no scissors wasting space
customer_reviews.author: K. J. K.

customer_reviews.title: EDC this. Love it. Belt clip works. American made
customer_reviews.text: I EDC this guy and a Husky folding utility knife. I love this leatherman. Got it to replace a Byrdco Byrdknife. Just a quality multitool which is great for a DIYer like myself.
customer_reviews.author: GoVegan

customer_reviews.title: Used Everyday
customer_reviews.text: Its a Leatherman so you know it will come as described and will be of a high quality. I have been using this everyday since Nov 2012. I have it on me when I'm home, at work...basically anywhere except for an airplane. My only issue is the weight in pocket. It came with a belt clip sleeve, but I'm not "that guy." I didn't keep it on me all the time at first. But then there were so many times I didn't have it with me and wished I had. If you need an all around pocket tool for everyday use don't hesitate to pick this up.
customer_reviews.author: McA

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tool... great 'first' multi-tool...
customer_reviews.text: Great 'starter' multi-tool, great for your first one. I bought this and had it for a wile, then I upgraded to a slightly 'bigger'/'more tools' model and gifted this one to my daughter. She loves it! Pricing and delivery were SUPER!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product how much use every day comes in handy just be alert that the knives are very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: good basic multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a real good pair of pliers and a few other things. Access to the knife blades without unfolding the handles is a nice design. Typical Leatherman flat phillips blade, large and small flat blades, knife, can opener, large and small saw blades. I'd rather have a bottle opener, a can opener is more of a survival tool, and I haven't really felt that I needed one in my pocket since I was in the boy scouts. ANY-way, if pliers are your main concern, this is probably the best in its price range. As a multi-tool, it seems pretty basic.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doaks

customer_reviews.title: A tool that does tool related things.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is adequate but not phenomenal. The tools work as described. Relatively light weight. Excellent choice for a budget multi-tool. I have carried mine every day since purchasing and it is still holding up just fine. It is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Winnifred

customer_reviews.title: Product is as advertised, Reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I have several leatherman tools and have been using for 20 years, this particular one is good buy.
customer_reviews.author: darrell a.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 7 years ago and it’s still going strong. I must find a use for it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: The best multitool I have, and I have many, I use it every day
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a firefighter and I am always finding things that I need tools to take care of. Some very simple tasks like breaking down boxes and some complex like changing the rollers on the IV drawer in the squad. I have used this tool nearly every shift since I bought it and I have cut trips to the tool box down considerably. Great tool and great quality. Would recommend to anybody who uses tools every day or even to keep in your car for those random times you need a few tools.
customer_reviews.author: NoxX22

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman Multi-Tool - Always a great product for camping, hiking, backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Leatherman all-purpose multi-tool. Placed item in my 3-day BUG OUT backpack for emergency getaway during a disaster. ( I also take my backpack camping with me) My only complaint is the single tools are very tight and hard to pull out; maybe they will loosen up with usage.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J.

customer_reviews.title: Always used my sons so I got one.
customer_reviews.text: I got my son one and continued to use his I finally got myself one. I use it all the time for photo related things, camping, hiking and around the house. The tools it has are fine for what I need. Its small enough and I find it very useful. The spring loaded pliers are great compared to an old Gerber Tool I have. Was fairly sharp out of the box but sharpened up with a stone easily. I would get this again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan F Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Needs a top notch case
customer_reviews.text: Two complaints: 1. Needs a better case. All Leatherman's competitors come with decent cases. These guys skimmed. 2. The bottle opener needs a better design as it is hard to open bottle caps I bought a Leatherman more for loyalty from past experience, but I have a SOG and Gerber multi-tool that seem more advanced and better designed. It does the job, but I think if it came with a good case, I would have rated it higher.
customer_reviews.author: tejanoman

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home with out one.
customer_reviews.text: So many tools in such a small package. I find my self no longer carrying my Swiss army knife. A knife I had kept on me for twenty five years.
customer_reviews.author: Vrond Winterwolf

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to wear all the time but big  enough to do the job
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and seems pretty well made. Small enough to wear all the time but big enough to do the job. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: USE IT
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time. And I know most of the guys are out there saying use the right tool for the right job. Yes I agree but sometimes you just need a little something to get you by, and this is it. I have had the sidekick and the wingman. I love them both it was hard when I broke the blade on my wingman and started to look for another one and found the sidekick. This sidekick has been great so far. Great purchase. I can recommend both wingman and sidekick.
customer_reviews.author: the gorethox

customer_reviews.title: Favorite pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I love all of the tools on this multi-tool. Both the saw and knife are amazingly sharp. I also love the spring loaded pliers. They work very well. All of the tools also lock in place for use very well. My only real complaint is that the wire cutters do not cut. They were ground at a 45 degree angle and expected to cut, but in order for a blade to cut, it should be ground at 30 degrees. It makes a big difference. Still, it is a Great tool, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Neville III

customer_reviews.title: It's a fine tool. I'm not going to lower the star ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine tool. I'm not going to lower the star rating for what amounts to personal preference. Nothing beats my original leatherman I purchased 20 years ago when I was in the infantry. It's still tight. Super compact and functional.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Very nice multi-tool, and for me the right size. Not too big, not too small, and everything's useful. I've used the knife, saw and serrated knife the most, along with the file/ruler and screwdrivers, but that's just me. The ability to open the knife and saw one handed is really nice. I've had this for over a year now and the knife is still very sharp, and everything's in good condition. The only downside is just that some of the tools are hard to use because of their positioning in the casing of the multi-tool but this is a very good tool, and has become one of the best-loved and most useful parts of my everyday carry setup.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: High quality and better than ever!
customer_reviews.text: I lost my original Leatherman's tool after 25 years. I used it almost every day for something. I loved it and miss it. So, I asked for a new one for my B'day and my wife replaced my tool with this the :SideKick" After a month I am getting use to it and the couple of additional tools are going to be handy. I use this one every days as well. I will learn to love this one too!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Herring

customer_reviews.title: Best Leatherman Tool for B&B Innkeeper & DIY
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for my essential Sidekick that was misplaced in our last move.
customer_reviews.author: DR NICK DEBONIS

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for what I needed it
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for what I needed it. Arrived in an approriate package and on time. One of the allen screws tha holds the arms together was a bit loose. Now I need to aquire two size 2 allen wrench to tighten it. Otherwise the quality of knife is great, razor sharp actualy. I haven't used the other tools except for the pliers and snips but pulled them out to see if they lock in place and I'm a happy camper thus far.
customer_reviews.author: D.Charriez

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman 831429 Sidekick Multi-Tool: All the right tools for the job
customer_reviews.text: I work with cameras and everyday I have to unscrew and tighten and attach equipment, and this tool does most of what I need. It’s really sturdy and this model is overloaded with pieces, so it’s really easy to access the tool you need. I received one as a gift, then bought another one because I liked it so much. If you need to be quick and always have the tool you need on hand, a Leatherman multitool is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: SaucyPuppetShow

customer_reviews.title: For instance Sidekick lacks an owl (so useful for making holes in thin metal
customer_reviews.text: Leatherman user for 20 years. Last model owned PST. Sidekick offers some advantages as well as disavantages. For instance Sidekick lacks an owl (so useful for making holes in thin metal, wood and plastics). also "ruler" and "file" are just an overly optimistic names for almost useless metal apendices. Be careful when deploying the tool open, -- stops torsion is high -- easy to pinch any fingertip. One good thing is it features a belt clip but no sheat.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE B.

customer_reviews.title: which is good. Had there been anything he disliked about it
customer_reviews.text: The husband takes this to work with him. He hasn't said anything about it, which is good. Had there been anything he disliked about it, believe me, I would have heard about it loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value to quality ratio
customer_reviews.text: Been using various multipliers for years. Bought this one, due to the good price. All of mine get pretty hard use, but like all of them, one part or another, wears or breaks. In the case it was the knife tip, and wire cutters, but it served me well.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaTwoNiner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL, GREAT QUALITY, GREAT PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best leatherman I've ever had, most leatherman multi tools are far too big to carry around. Not this one, if you are looking for a multi tool that you can carry around the same as you would a pocket knife this is the one for you, and don't be fooled, this leatherman is not too small it is still in the full size tool category it is just a little more compact. I wear mine in my right front pocket utilizing the pocket clip, and I use the tool every day for anything imaginable. GREAT TOOL GREAT QUALITY, GREAT PRICE!!
customer_reviews.author: Cody R

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for the money
customer_reviews.text: Needed a multi tool and this fit the bill. I didn't want one with everything under the sun, just necessities. Great item and quality made.
customer_reviews.author: Steven1911

customer_reviews.title: TSA keeps taking my knifes when i check it. ...
customer_reviews.text: TSA keeps taking my knifes when i check it. but i always buy this knife... conspiracy? no, probably not. but i do get this knife over and over again because its well designed and strong. has a bunch of tools you'll probably need, and is strong and quick to open
customer_reviews.author: Samantha T.

product_meta.title: LEATHERMAN, Sidekick Pocket Size Multitool with Spring-Action Pliers and Saw, Stainless Steel with Nylon Sheath
feature_bullets: YOUR SIDEKICK: A clean and versatile multitool that fits in your pocket and has all the features you need to get projects done
14 TOOLS IN 1: The Sidekick is equipped with 14 tools, including knives, pliers, screwdrivers, wire cutters, bottle and can openers, a file, a saw and a ruler

OUR GUARANTEE: We’re proud to stand behind every product that leaves our factory in Portland, Oregon; That’s why we offer our 25-year warranty, so you can be confident your Leatherman lasts a lifetime
ONE-HAND ACCESS: Enjoy a mix of outside-accessible blades you can open with one hand and rounded handles that make gripping the spring-action jaws easy and very comfortable
ALWAYS ON HAND: Its compact size and lightweight design makes it easy to slide into a sheath or your pocket; Alternatively, attach your Sidekick with its integrated lanyard ring

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,756 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
